title: Dean & Don's Farm Market | Virginia Schedule 2025 Updated
text: Nestled in the heart of Newport News, Virginia, Dean and Don’s Farm Market has been a beloved destination for fresh, locally sourced produce and community gatherings. Since opening for the 2025 season, the market continues to offer a vibrant selection of fruits, vegetables, and artisanal goods that reflect the rich agricultural heritage of the region. Whether you’re a longtime resident or a first-time visitor, Dean and Don’s Farm Market provides a welcoming atmosphere where quality and community come together. Table of Contents ToggleDean & Don’s Farm Market Schedule - Address: 12601 Warwick Blvd, Newport News, VA 23606 - Phone: (757) 930-2707 Opening Hours Parking: Ample free parking is available on-site, making your visit convenient and stress-free. Dean and Don’s Farm Market operates seasonally, typically from April through late fall. Visit Saunders Brothers Farm Market and Century Farm Market. Seasonal Highlights Spring kicks off with fresh strawberries, asparagus, and spring greens. The market often hosts planting workshops and gardening sessions to help visitors start their own gardens. Summer brings a bounty of tomatoes, corn, peaches, and melons, with events like live music, food truck festivals, and family activities. Fall celebrates the harvest with pumpkins, gourds, and apples, highlighted by the annual Fall Festival featuring hayrides, corn mazes, and seasonal treats. During winter, the market closes, but special holiday pop-up events and seasonal offerings appear—check their website and social media for updates. Vendor List - Produce & Organics: Fresh fruits and vegetables sourced from local farms, ensuring peak quality and flavor. - Meats, Eggs & Dairy: Farm-fresh eggs, artisanal cheeses, and locally raised meats to complete your grocery list. - Flowers & Garden Center: Seasonal flowers, potted plants, and gardening supplies to beautify your home and garden. - Bakery & Coffee: Homemade breads, pastries, and locally roasted coffee—perfect for a morning treat or afternoon pick-me-up. - Handmade Crafts & Local Art: Unique handmade candles, soaps, and artwork crafted by local artisans. Nearby Public Transit The closest bus stop is at Warwick Blvd & Hidenwood Shopping Center, serviced by Hampton Roads Transit (HRT). There’s no train service directly to the market, so driving or using local bus routes is recommended for convenience. Food Truck Info Food trucks are a regular attraction at Dean and Don’s Farm Market, especially on weekends and during special events. Popular vendors include Lobster King’s, known for fresh Maine lobster rolls and seafood dishes, and One Love Jamaican Kitchen, offering authentic Caribbean cuisine bursting with flavor. Nearby Hotels - Kingsmill Resort – About 13.5 miles away; a luxurious resort with full amenities. - The Colonies at Williamsburg – Roughly 14 miles away; family-friendly with spacious accommodations. - Hampton Inn Newport News–Yorktown – Just 5 miles away; comfortable and close to major attractions. Nearby Restaurants - Soprano Italian Restaurant: Cozy spot serving classic Italian fare in a warm atmosphere. - Schooners Grill: Relaxed eatery known for its seafood dishes and casual vibe. - Al Fresco Restaurant: Elegant Italian dining with a diverse menu and outdoor seating. FAQs Are pets allowed? Yes, leashed pets are welcome at Dean and Don’s Farm Market. Do they accept credit cards? Yes, most vendors accept credit cards, but it’s advisable to carry some cash for smaller purchases. Are there bathrooms on-site? Yes, restroom facilities are available for customer use. Is the market open during winter? The market operates seasonally and is typically closed during the winter months. Final Thoughts Dean and Don’s Farm Market is more than just a place to shop; it’s a community hub where locals and visitors alike come together to enjoy fresh produce, unique goods, and a friendly atmosphere. Whether you’re looking to stock up on groceries, find a special gift, or simply enjoy a day out, the market offers something for everyone. Be sure to check their website and Facebook page for the latest updates on events and offerings. For a complete list of local markets, check out our Virginia Farmers Markets guide.
